div.p: In the 36th year of Caesar, on Mecheir 2, Anchorinphis, son of Ischis, paid to Heraklas, the agent of Ptolemaios (?), son of Ara( ) (?), public banker, for the syntaximon of the same year, for Apias, eight silver drachmas = 8 dr, and on the … of Pharmouthi, twelve dr. = 12 dr., and on the 23rd of Pauni, twelve dr. = 12 dr., and on the 1st of Mesore, eight dr. = 8 dr. Year 37 of Caesar, Phaophi 30. Anchorinphis, son of Ischis, paid to Heraklas, the agent of Psoaramounis, public banker, for the syntaximon of the thirty-sixth year … four silver (?) dr. = 4 dr. Translation by W. Graham Claytor, BASP 53 (2016) 130
